column2: HAWAII DMV TEST
column4: Hawaii
column6: HI

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Drivers often fail to see a motorcycle headed toward them. Why?
column4: It is  hard to judge how far away a motorcycle is.
column6: Motorcycles are hard to see.
column8: It is difficult to judge a motorcycle's speed.

column2: 2. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, if the road you enter has two lanes, you:
column4: must turn into its left lane.
column6: must turn into its right lane.
column8: must go to the next intersection.

column2: 3. What is a likely effect when you take another drug while you drink alcohol?
column4: The effects of alcohol are reduced by the drug.
column6: The effects of the alcohol and the drug are enhanced.
column8: There are no effects, unless the drug is prescription only.
column10: If the drug is over-the-counter, there are no effects.

column2: 4. You have been charged with driving under the influence of alcohol, and have refused to take the required test for blood alcohol. You may lose your driver’s license for twelve months:
column4: because you have refused to take the test.
column6: You won’t lose your license.
column8: only if you are convicted of driving while under the influence of alcohol.
column10: only if you are convicted of a traffic violation.

column2: 5. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: the highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways. Drivers should keep to the right.
column6: there is a double curve ahead.
column8: there is a low place in the road.
column10: there is a winding road ahead.

column2: 6. This sign means:
column4: Vehicles may only turn left.
column6: The center lane is shared for left turns.
column8: Left turns in both directions of travel are not permitted.

column2: 7. This sign indicates the _______________ vehicles can safely travel in this area.
column4: minimum speed
column6: maximum speed
column8: suggested speed

column2: 8. When getting ready to change lanes, you should:
column4: check your side view mirror.
column6: quickly turn your head to check for other vehicles.
column8: check your rearview mirror.

column2: 9. This road sign means:
column4: Railroad Warning
column6: Winding road ahead
column8: Warning, slippery when wet

column2: 10. This sign means:
column4: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.
column6: Divided highway ahead.
column8: Keep to the left.

column2: 11. Following the vehicle ahead too closely is the cause of many traffic accidents. Always maintain a minimum _____ following distance.
column4: 100 feet
column6: 2 seconds
column8: 150 feet

column2: 12. What do pennant-shaped signs indicate?
column4: School crossing
column6: A school crossing
column8: Yield

column2: 13. When towing a trailer load, about ________ of the total trailer weight should be on the vehicle’s trailer hitch.
column4: 10 to 15 percent
column6: 20 to 25 percent
column8: 5 to 10 percent

column2: 14. Traffic signs and pavement markings must be:
column4: followed only when a police officer is present.
column6: used as a guide only.
column8: followed only when other vehicles are present.

column2: 15. What is the only effective method to reduce your BAC?
column4: Exercise.
column6: Drinking coffee.
column8: Not drinking over a period of time.
column10: Eating before or while you drink.

column2: 16. Before backing up, you should:
column4: flash your headlights.
column6: get off the car to see if it is clear to proceed.
column8: turn your head and look through the rear window.
column10: rely on your mirrors to see if it is clear to proceed.

column2: 17. If another car has stopped in an adjacent lane in the same direction of travel, you should:
column4: be careful in case the other vehicle has stopped for a pedestrian.
column6: pass the car on the left.
column8: speed up and pass the vehicle on the right.
column10: tap your horn to let the other driver know you are passing.

column2: 18. This road sign means:
column4: Right turn is not permitted
column6: A left turn can be made only after stopping
column8: All traffic must turn right at the next intersection

column2: 19. Where must a pedestrian walk when there are no sidewalks?
column4: In the middle of the road, facing oncoming traffic.
column6: On the side of the road, in the same direction of traffic.
column8: On the left side of the road, behind slower vehicles.
column10: On the side of the road, facing the traffic.

column2: 20. A flashing red light means:
column4: Drive with caution.
column6: The same as a STOP sign.
column8: Go, but yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.
column10: The light will soon change to steady red.

column2: 21. A vehicle that enters a road from a driveway:
column4: must enter the roadway immediately.
column6: must yield to traffic approaching from the right, while it has the right-of-way over vehicles approaching from the left.
column8: must stop and yield the right-of-way to traffic on the roadway and to pedestrians.

column2: 22. When changing lanes or at intersections near heavy trucks drivers and highway users must make allowances for:
column4: the increased speed of larger vehicles.
column6: the increased noise made by larger vehicles.
column8: the increased stopping distance required by large vehicles.
column10: the decreased stopping distance required by large vehicles.

column2: 23. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
column6: make a U-turn into the two-way road.
column8: enter the two-way road to the right of its center line.
column10: turn left into the one-way road.

column2: 24. A large vehicle is backing up to unload goods. You should:
column4: enter one of the blind spots and wait.
column6: be patient and wait until the large vehicle has completed its backup maneuver.
column8: try to pass close behind.

column2: 25. Which signs have black letters on a yellow or orange background?
column4: Regulatory signs (vertical rectangle)
column6: Warning signs (diamond)
column8: Railroad advance warning signs (round)

column2: 26. You are driving forward out of your driveway:
column4: you must come to a complete stop before crossing the sidewalk area.
column6: if you honk your horn, you can cross the sidewalk area without stopping.
column8: you have the right of way over pedestrians on a sidewalk area.
column10: you must slow down before crossing the sidewalk area.

column2: 27. This road sign means:
column4: Traffic is entering from another road, drive with caution
column6: Lane shifting
column8: Yield right-of-way

column2: 28. Which of the following is true about the Anti-Locking Brake System?
column4: It allows drivers to steer during an emergency braking situation.
column6: It prevents skidding.
column8: Can help improve vehicle stability.

column2: 29. You arrive at the same time as another vehicle at an intersection has no traffic signs or signals. You should:
column4: sound your horn and drive through the intersection with extreme caution.
column6: speed up and get through the intersection.
column8: drive through the intersection and make the other vehicle stop.
column10: slow down and yield to the vehicle on the right.

column2: 30. This road sign means:
column4: Wrong Way
column6: Merging Traffic
column8: Curve ahead
